info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 4:41AM EDT until June 15 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
.Rainfall Friday through Saturday morning totaling mainly 3 to 6 inches across portions of northern central Indiana has produced flooding along area Wildcat Creek. Minor flooding near Jerome has crested...yet is expected to continue through at least Sunday morning.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding in progress along Wildcat Creek in eastern Howard County. Water possibly two feet deep on CR 174 S just west of Jerome Bridge on CR 1030 E. Canoe area at SR 213 and nearby park flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EDT Sunday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
